## Introduction

This document presents the analysis of Week 12 reaction time data. The dataset contains measurements from 60 participants across baseline, control, and experimental conditions, with participants assigned to either Happy or Scary experimental conditions.

## Loading the Data


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Data loaded successfully!
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Dataset dimensions: 60 participants × 11 variables
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 6 × 11
     ID Condition Base1 Base2 Base3 Control1 Control2 Control3 Expt1 Expt2 Expt3
  <int>     <int> <int> <int> <int>    <int>    <int>    <int> <int> <int> <int>
1     1         1    16    20    20       12        9       11    12    11    15
2     2         1    16     5    12       20       14       12     7    20    10
3     3         1    20    15    18        8        9       20     7    12    19
4     4         1    19    13    11       16       18       11    16    12    16
5     5         1    17     8    20       17       19       10    16     5    19
6     6         1    18    20    21       10       20       18     9    11     7
```


:::
:::


The dataset contains reaction time measurements with the following structure:

- **ID**: Participant identifier
- **Condition**: Experimental condition (1 = Happy, 2 = Scary)
- **Base1, Base2, Base3**: Three baseline condition trials
- **Control1, Control2, Control3**: Three control condition trials  
- **Expt1, Expt2, Expt3**: Three experimental condition trials

## Task 1: Calculate Overall Means

Calculate the mean for baseline, control, and experimental conditions (averaging across all trials and participants).
